title: Harini going to supermarket, Prez walking to work: time to stop grandstanding: opposition MP
byline: Referring to the recent actions of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya which has gained much publicity, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Nalin Bandara Jayamaha yesterday said both should stop grandstanding

title: Dilruwan steps down from NSC to become U-19 Spin Coach
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) are yet to appoint a replacement for Dilruwan Perera, who stepped down from his role as a member of the National Selection Committee (NSC) last week.

title: Govt. decides not to re-conduct Grade 5 Scholarship Exam: AG tells SC
byline: The Attorney General’s Department today informed the Supreme Court that the Cabinet of Ministers has recommended not to re-conduct the Grade 5 Scholarship Examination, taking into consideration the mental stress students would undergo and the adverse effects it would have on the scheduled examination calendar.

title: EC issues ultimatum to candidates over expense reports
byline: The Election Commission has announced that all candidates must submit their income and expenditure reports by December 6, with the deadline set at midnight.

title: GCE (O/L) exams 2024 (2025) registration deadline extended
byline: The Examinations Department has extended the deadline for online registration for the 2024 (2025) GCE Ordinary Level (O/L) examinations for both government schools and private candidates.

title: Three dead and dozens sick after eating sea turtle stew
byline: Three people have died and at least 32 were hospitalised in the Philippines after eating an endangered sea turtle cooked in stew.

title: Candidates must submit expense reports before Dec. 6 – EC
byline: The Election Commission has announced that all candidates must submit their income and expenditure reports by December 6, with the deadline set at midnight.

title: Coconut dropped by monkey kills man
byline: A man who received serious internal injuries when a young coconut dropped by a monkey fell on his head died after admission to the intensive care unit of the Kegalle General Hospital.

title: Saman Edema no more
byline: Former Vidyartha, Kandy SC, Havelock SC, Dimbula Athletic and Cricket Club, one of the referees from Central Province, and former Technical Officer of Sri Lanka Rugby Football Union, Saman Edema passed away in Matale after a brief illness.

title: SLMC’s Mohamadu Sally Nahim sworn in as MP
byline: Mohamadu Sally Nahim was sworn in as an MP before Speaker Asoka Ranwala a short while ago.

title: Musk’s record $56bn pay deal rejected for second time
byline: Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s record-breaking $56bn (£47bn) pay award will not be reinstated, a judge has ruled.

title: SSP Manathunga appointed Director of Police Media, replacing DIG Thalduwa
byline: Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) K.B. Manathunga has been appointed as the new Director of the Police Media Division and Police Spokesman, replacing DIG Nihal Thalduwa.

title: US Assistant Secretary Donald Lu to visit SL on Dec 5
byline: Assistant Secretary of State for the Bureau of South and Central Asian Affairs, Donald Lu, will visit Sri Lanka on December 5.

title: Women officers take charge of key Police Divisions
byline: For the first time in Sri Lanka’s police history, several female officers have been appointed to senior positions in key divisions, including the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) and the Special Investigation Unit.

title: Lankan businessman nabbed with Rs. 5 million worth cosmetics
byline: A Sri Lankan air passenger was arrested at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) while attempting to smuggle in cosmetic items worth Rs. 5 million.

title: Sri Lanka Navy seeks more joint operations with India to curb drug smuggling
byline: Following the recent seizure of large quantities of narcotics in the Indian Ocean by the Indian Navy, the Sri Lanka Navy is looking to enhance collaborative deployments and operations with its Indian counterparts, especially in the high seas, to combat narcotics trafficking.

title: Russian Embassy responds to reports of Jaffna youths forced to fight against Ukraine
byline: In response to reports that some young men from Jaffna were allegedly forced to fight in the war against Ukraine while attempting to travel to France and Belgium on visit visas, the Russian Embassy in Colombo said yesterday that it had not received any official information about the recruitment of Sri Lankan citizens by unscrupulous local travel agencies.

title: Police to use drones for monitoring traffic congestion in Colombo
byline: Sri Lanka Police will begin using drone cameras to monitor traffic congestion in Colombo and its surrounding suburbs.

title: CG Corp Global bets big on SL’s recovery and growth
byline: Chaudhary Group (CG) Corp Global, a Nepal-based multinational conglomerate, reaffirmed its commitment to Sri Lanka yesterday, pledging to remain invested in the long term while identifying opportunities to expand further.

title: SL will soon need to cut down number of state sector employees: Senior presidential advisor
byline: Sri Lanka will not be able to afford a large public sector in the near future and will soon need to start reducing the number of state employees, a senior advisor to the president said yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka ranked 4th best country for long vacations in global study
byline: Sri Lanka has been ranked among the top five destinations in the world for long vacations in a study conducted by Ubuy India, a global e-commerce platform.

title: Construction sector still uncertain about much-awaited tax concessions
byline: Sri Lanka’s construction industry said it is still uncertain about receiving its much-awaited tax concessions, as the industry stakeholders opine that the government’s requirement to meet the International Monetary Fund (IMF)-driven fiscal targets in its budget next year may leave little room for relief.

title: Govt. to revise electricity tariff soon, refutes 3-year claim
byline: The government will take measures to revise the electricity tariff by a certain margin, and it will not take three years as claimed by Trade Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe, Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: South Korea declares emergency martial law, warns of ’’communist forces’’
byline: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol declared an ’’emergency martial law’’ on Tuesday, accusing the country’s opposition of controlling the parliament, sympathizing with North Korea and paralyzing the government with anti-state activities.

title: Government approves purchase of locally made medicines
byline: The government has decided to purchase locally produced medicines and medical supplies for a one-year period, following approval at the Cabinet meeting held on October 14, 2024.

title: French government on brink as Prime Minister faces no-confidence vote
byline: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier is bracing for a no-confidence vote in parliament on Wednesday in which parties from the left and the right are expected to join forces to oust him after he forced through his budget without lawmakers’ consent.

title: No action taken on assigning same-zone exam supervisors: CTU
byline: The Ceylon Teachers’ Union (CTU) claimed that no action has been taken to remove examination supervisors assigned from schools within the same educational zone.

title: Rs. 6,000 allowance for school children to obtain stationaries
byline: To minimise the negative effects on schoolchildren, the Cabinet has approved a proposal to provide an allowance of Rs. 6,000 for purchasing stationery as outlined below, prior to the commencement of the 2025 academic year.

title: I was beaten by Opposition MP: Ramanathan Archchuna
byline: affna District independenet MP Ramanathan Archchuna said he was beaten by SJB MP Sujith Sanjaya Perera when he visited the Opposition Leader’s office.

title: Unfortunate incidents never occurred during our protests: Mahinda Jayasinghe
byline: Claiming that several police officials had sustained cut injuries during yesterday’s protest outside the Education Ministry, Deputy Minister Mahinda Jayasinghe said today, he as trade union leader, had resorted to trade union actions with thousands of people but such unfortunate incidents had never occurred.

title: Super luxury vehicles in government institutions to be disposed
byline: The Government has decided to dispose super luxury vehicles used in government institutions given their high maintenance and fuel costs.

title: Will address drugs shortages soon: Minister
byline: Actions will be taken to resolve the shortage in medicines including Sodium bicarbonate within the next few days, Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Australian dies after jumping from apartment in Kollupitiya
byline: A 51-year-old Australian national has reportedly committed suicide by jumping from the Crescat apartment complex in Kollupitiya this morning.

title: Minister urges large-scale rice millers to release stock
byline: Cabinet spokesman and Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa urged large-scale rice millers to release their rice stocks, considering it as an essential duty.

title: Cabinet nod to cancel 2023 LG polls nominations
byline: The Cabinet has granted approval to cancel the nominations previously called for the Local Government elections originally scheduled for 2023, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Nalinda Jayatissa announced today.

title: No price revision on Litro gas
byline: Litro Gas Lanka Limited has decided not to increase the retail price of a 12.5 kg LP gas cylinder, even though gas prices in the international market have risen, Litro Chairman Channa Gunawardana said.

title: Walk the talk: Sajith tells government
byline: The Government should deliver what it had pledged at the electoral platform, especially with regard to debt sustainability agreements and the agreement with the IMF, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa told Parliament today.

title: Will take all possible actions to defeat attempts to incite racism: PM
byline: The government will take all possible actions to defeat attempts by various groups that were defeated through the political transformation, to incite racism for their petty political gains, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya said today.

title: Vietnamese tycoon loses death row appeal over world’s biggest bank fraud
byline: Vietnamese property tycoon Truong My Lan has lost her appeal against her death sentence for masterminding the world’s biggest bank fraud.

title: GCE (A/L) exams to resume tomorrow
byline: The 2024 GCE Advanced Level (A/L) Examinations which were postponed till today (3) due to adverse weather conditions, are scheduled to resume tomorrow (4), the Examinations Department said.

title: Gayantha appointed Chief Opposition Whip
byline: SJB Galle District MP Gayantha Karunathilaka has been appointed as Chief Opposition Whip, Speaker Dr. Ashoka Ranwala announced today.

title: First debate of 10th Parliament today
byline: The first debate of the 10th Parliament will begin at 9.30 am today, where the MPs will speak on the policy statement presented to the House by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake on November 21.

title: Coconut cream in place of coconuts to address shortage
byline: Coconut cream which is now only an export product will be released to the local market to address the coconut shortage in the market, an official said.
